src_text: Na Bikua ôko, Sara Danius Wakua su ti ndôkua ti mungo kota makanda ti sungo mbéti ti kodro ti Suede a tènè polele na dafönönö tènè na ndô ti dafönönö ti Sveries na yâ bungbi ti Suede, sô a wara légé ti tingbi na Bob Dylan lè na lè na ndô tènè ti warango makanda ti sungo mbéti ti lo nga ngü 2016, na lo zia légé ti ngingo péko ti lo.
ref_text: On Monday, Sara Danius, permanent secretary of the Nobel Committee for Literature at the Swedish Academy, publicly announced during a radio program on Sveriges Radio in Sweden the committee, unable to reach Bob Dylan directly about winning the 2016 Nobel Prize in Literature, had abandoned its efforts to reach him.
hyp_text: In Sweden, Sara Danius, the head of the Academy, said that the Swedish Academy's decision to award the Nobel Prize in Literature to Bob Dylan in 2016 was a mistake, as he does not meet the criteria for the award, which is to be a Swedish citizen or have strong ties to Sweden, and Dylan has no connection to Sweden.

src_text: Danius a tènè, "Na ndëmbë sô i yéké sala yé ôko pèpè. Mbi pika singa, na mbi tokua mbéti na gbandatèrè na â zo sô a yéké nduru na lo, na mbi wara â nzoni kiringo tènè. Ti ngoye sô, a lingbi tongaso."
ref_text: Danius said, "Right now we are doing nothing. I have called and sent emails to his closest collaborator and received very friendly replies. For now, that is certainly enough."
hyp_text: Danius said, 'I've been thinking, the problem is that they don't understand each other. If you take a small stone, put it on a big stone, and then put another big stone on top, it will roll down. And if you repeat this process, the stones will roll down, and it will be a slope. And if you continue like this, you'll get a mountain.'

src_text: Ndôkua sangö ti gbanda-tèrè TMZ a bi tènè pèpè na li ti wangosinga sô a louti na kutukutu ti lo ti mü â talato na tèrè ti légé ti Sepulveda na lo tara ti mü â talato ti pulusu kozô si lo fâ légé na ti mü légé ti hon , na ndô ti légé ti Californie kozô si â pulusu a hounda lo ti hon ti fâni usè ni.
ref_text: Entertainment news website TMZ understands the photographer stopped his vehicle on the other side of Sepulveda Boulevard and attempted to take pictures of the police stop before crossing the road and continuing, prompting the California Highway Patrol police officer conducting the traffic stop to order him back across, twice.
hyp_text: The TMZ website, which has been a major source of celebrity gossip and news, was founded in 2005 by Kevin and Richard Schwarz, and was initially a spin-off of the entertainment news section of the New York Daily News, which was later sold to the Canadian media conglomerate, CanWest, in 2008. Today, TMZ is a subsidiary of Warner Bros. and has become one of the most popular entertainment news websites in the world, with millions of visitors daily. It is known for its scoops and breaking news on celebrity scandals, divorces, and other juicy gossip.

src_text: Déterminisme ti a fini kodëkua a yeke ye so a bumbi gba ti a bibê na ya ti sara ngo ye, so a londo na fini kodëkua wara përëngö-ndo fini kodëkua, wara na sêyêtara âdu tî so päsä ti a zo a yeke fa lêgë na ye ti boroli ti gbeni so a bumbi na a ndïä ti gïngösêndâyê na a fumbä ti ala na ya ti fini kodëkua.

src_text: Mingui ti a fa ngo tènè na ti déterminisme ti kodëkua a kangbi böndöngö bibê ûse : ti tènè mäïngö na fini kodëkua, lo mû pekô ti kötä legue na ndo ti a lëngö-ngangü ti hïngängö-mbëtï wara porosö na fini kodëkua na türünëngö ti pendâ na ndo ti a sociétés ti so mëngö ti tènè socialement.
ref_text: Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has "effects" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned.
hyp_text: The concept of determinism in the philosophy of the French thinker Jean-Paul Sartre is based on the idea that human beings are free to choose their own path in life, but that these choices are influenced by the social and cultural context in which they are made. This means that our choices are not determined by external factors, but are instead the result of a complex interplay between our individual desires, the social structures we inhabit, and the cultural norms that shape our perceptions and behaviors. According to Sartre, we are 'condemned to be free', meaning that we have the freedom to choose our own path, but that this freedom also brings with it a sense of responsibility and accountability for the choices we make.

src_text: Dengo yaka ti subsistance ayeke systeme so ayeke senge, lakue biologique, so a mû a le ti a kasa so a a bata ni na lêgë ti écorégion so a bungbi na bïrïngïngö ti a ye ti yaka wara na a mbeni kode kua so ayeke senge ti sara si a kobe ni a sigi mingi.
ref_text: Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield.
hyp_text: The subsistence system is based on a biological cycle, where the food chain is linked to the ecosystem of the region, and the balance is maintained through the code of the forest, where the inhabitants have learned to live in harmony with nature, and the impact of human activities is minimal, allowing the ecosystem to thrive.
